intro: Iteadaphne philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine sandalwood, is a small evergreen tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, smooth, and dark-colored wood. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a glossy surface. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by oval, woody fruits. Due to its limited distribution and slow growth, it is considered a valuable and endangered species in its native habitat.
